experience: You and Joshua both know Stephen Houghton, McKenna Moreau, and 4 others
Joshua can introduce you to 25 people at Apple
Director Windows Infrastructure, Cloud Collaboration, User Technology & Technical Solutions Group

My primary role with the Windows Infrastructure and Cloud Collaboration teams includes strategic planning and implementation of Stanford's Windows and SaaS systems. We focus on providing campus solutions around online directory services, federated identity infrastructure, email infrastructure, calendaring, identity management, authentication, messaging, collaboration, and mobile device management (MDM). In addition, this group is responsible for guiding Stanford's technical roadmap in these areas for the larger university community. These operational responsibilities frequently involve working with or guiding other groups across campus on implementation and integration strategies for projects within every organization at Stanford.•Oversee daily operations of Windows Infrastructure and Cloud Collaboration teams, as well as provide extended leadership of the End User Technology and Technical Solutions Group teams. •Successful migration from on premise ProofPoint & Exchange environments to completely cloud mail routing and Exchange Online.•Guiding campus to meet 2019 DR and carbon footprint goals of 50% compute infrastructure residing in the cloud.•Deploy advanced security systems including two factor authentication, firewall hardening, application white listing, and red forest model. •Own campus wide MDM solution, working with Information Security Office, Stanford affiliates, and multiple Service Desk teams to constantly improve security processes. •Design and own governance process with the Office of the General Counsel for university policy adherence and investigations. •Increase partnership of Infrastructure, Service Desk, and NOC teams to better distribute knowledge, training, and to resolve system issues more quickly.

•Principal Consultant for IT policy, process, and infrastructure build out for General Motor’s autonomous driving start up Cruise Automation. •Assist with migrating from start up infrastructure, policy, and culture to new collaborative corporate environment. •Deploy more secure wired and wireless networking improvements to multiple offices in three states. •Implement asset management, tracking and at rest encryption solution for all end points deployed. •MDM solution implementation for all company issued mobile devices and in vehicle systems. •Creation of on boarding and off boarding training and cross team processes within automation team and corporate team. •Roll out SSO solution for multiple SaaS/IaaS providers to increase account security and simply user login experience.

•Guide the growth of IT team. Starting with a 4 person team supporting 4,000 employees in 7 states and grew it to a mature organization of more than 40 technicians, analysts and specialists supporting 16,000 employees across 14 states and 4 countries in less than three years.•Improve system availability and outage response times by organizing advanced outage alerting, tracking and downtime accountability.•Establish 24 x 7 x 365 support desk, with built in systematic escalation for true 24 hour availability. •Creation of real time Global Operations Center for total network, application, outage and threat monitoring using a combination of onsite staffing, structured procedures and automated alerting for over 100 internal applications across more than 150 international locations.•Consolidate traditional service desk with application development teams for a more well rounded technology organization, improving cross department collaboration and user support experience.•Deploy new cross department incident tracking system, combining 13 support groups onto single unified platform to improve the user support experience with no down time and zero user visibility. •Lead team in initiative to convert existing on premise Exchange and SharePoint systems to Office 365 and deploy Office 2016 to more than 16,000 international employees.•Formation of a formalized Change Management process to track, evaluate and approve changes before releasing them into production. •Develop, define and implement the SOX controls and compliance program for SolarCity.•Construction of a scalable automation platform to accommodate the company's massive growth.•Increase IT transparency across the company by conceiving an IT brand as well as improving both IT communications and user understanding of IT functions.

•Oversee daily operations for the IT Service Desk, Security Operations, Audio/Visual, GOC, Analytics and Communications teams.•Continue to guide growth of the IT team from 4,000 employee organization to a 13,000 employee organization in less than two years.•Reorganize IT Support Teams to run lean while supporting an explosive user base and sales growth. •Development of Special IT team focusing on automation, user communication, branding, and public team metrics.•Stabilize fluctuating IT roles through new policy development, aggressive hiring, and process optimization.•Creation of Information Security policies to regulate internal user access of all SOX controlled roles to achieve compliance.•Conduct live quarterly international multimedia broadcasts of key leadership outlining company milestones and goals.•Assess, advise, demonstrate, and train executives to help determine the right technologies required for upcoming projects.•Assist security administrators in policy creation as well as updating, maintaining, and troubleshooting problems within Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Great Plains, Salesforce, Confluence, SharePoint, HRIS, and Kaspersky anti-virus.•Streamline termination procedures to meet the needs of a distributed company, comply with growing security requirements and to better track monthly reclamation of assets, leading to prevention of more than $500,000 worth of lost equipment in the first twelve months.•Create and maintain knowledge base items for IT technicians and user support documentation, training videos, and other special projects.•Define key performance metrics to better monitor, mentor, and develop team’s efficiency and productivity.•Author all company-wide IT communications for outages, change control, notices, and events.•Drive new company strategies and projects through intra-department coordination and company wide roll outs.

•Coordinating four distinct geographic desktop support teams. Mentor and train more than a dozen technical support analysts across all locations. •Running metrics on team workloads and SLAs.  Coaching help desk personnel and helping them exceed user expectations. •Assume responsibility and ownership for escalated technical software issues.  •Working with software development teams to facilitate communication of known issues and planned changes through to technical teams and end users. •Creating and updating internal documentation, knowledge base articles, and user training modules for the entire company.  •Technical representative In charge of high visibility special projects for Marketing and Sales departments.  •Primary Active Directory administrator in charge of domain user/group permissions and ensuring meeting SOX compliance.•Traveling to and working out of remote office to assist on site staff and aid in training users.•Assisted company users with technical issues, strategic assessments as well as provided education on computers, tablets, printers, wifi devices, Apple/Android smart phones, and corporate software for more than 4,000 users across the U.S.  •Served in security role updating, maintaining, and troubleshooting problems within Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Great Plains, PeopleSoft, and Salesforce. Created termination procedures to meet security requirements and save on operations costs.•Inherited the role of Kaspersky anti-virus administrator.  Keeping our licensing and databases up to date while troubleshooting any problems that may have occurred on end user machines. •Required travel to offices throughout the country for on site setup and support. •Maintained knowledge base items for IT technicians and user support documentation, training videos, and other special projects.

•Advise and provide appraisals of entrepreneurial ventures for technologies developed at the University of Arizona. •Recommend when to seek commercialization of new intellectual property, innovations and technologies.•Develop plans for efficient transfer of technology to industry or new business ventures.•Support development of business models and marketability strategies for innovations and technologies developed by students, alumni, researchers, and faculty.

Joshua was a key player in supporting the hyper growth that SolarCity went through in 2013/2014. During our peak, we were on-boarding ~400 employees a week. Joshua started out on our tech support team as an analyst, but he quickly proved his adaptability and leadership and was promoted to lead our entire tech support team. Samuel is a very detail oriented worker who is always willing to go the extra mile to resolve user security and access issues. He is very technically knowledgeable and understands how to apply industry standards and best practices to a dynamic corporate environment. Samuel is always reliable and rises to meet any situation. When Samuel first joined SolarCity, he helped to build the new Security Operations team from scratch. By working with the existing IT teams, developers, auditors and business units, Samuel was able to better define and document existing processes while identifying ways to improve them. Samuel continued to work with all involved to ensure the security and reliability of high risk information. In addition to his normal duties, Samuel often worked toward mentoring the growing Security Operations team and educating users, auditors, developers and his IT teammates to be more security minded. The knowledge and hard work Samuel brings to a team is invaluable and I would recommend him for a similar position.
